website_summaries.verdict: With its huge series of near-effortless recipes and handy dietary tips, it’s the ultimate cookbook for diabetics who own a slow cooker.
pros: A whopping 550 diabetic-friendly recipes made easy with the aid of a slow cooker
Examples include beef stew, venison stew, and Asian pepper steak
Details how to use a meal plan
cons: Not too helpful if you don’t have a slow cooker

customer_reviews.title: No list of recipes anywhere
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to fix dinners for my mom after she was released from rehab. The recipes so far have been pretty tasteless but ok. The main problem with this cookbook is the layout. There is no Table of Contents listing individual recipes and no Index. It is very difficult to use because of this.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Mason

customer_reviews.title: Not too impressed. Most of the recipes are diabetic ...
customer_reviews.text: Not too impressed. Most of the recipes are diabetic friendly, but a lot of them have a WAY higher carbohydrate content than what I’m looking for. Carbs shoot my blood sugar levels way too high!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Slow Cooker Cookbook for Diabetics!
customer_reviews.text: Very helpful cookbook for a newly diagnosed type 2 diabetic. I was having a hard time imagining what I could cook in my crockpot now. This gave me some great ideas. There are some basic tips in the book as well. I spent a lot of time going thru the book and marking the ones I wanted to try with post it notes. I am glad I picked this book!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel N.

customer_reviews.title: Type II cook book. Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: This author knows what she is talking about. Very credible. So many recipes explained in plain English, nutritional values plainly delineated. Now, if she would only put this same information out for the electric pressure cooker crowd. If there was an excuse, I'd buy another copy because it is so good. Robert E Clark, Santa Monica, CA 10/20/2017
customer_reviews.author: Robert E. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Healthy Recipes...
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for my mom to cook for my newly-diagnosed diabetic step-dad. She said it is an awesome and non-complicated recipe book. She loved it! My step-dad, however, said "It looks like it is full of healthy stuff...no fun at all!" (He doesn't get it yet, but he will :)
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Delicious!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book intending to make some of the recipes myself, but my wife grabbed the book first and started cooking. Tried five or six recipes so far and every one was absolutely delicious. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Max Headspace

customer_reviews.title: Not for this diabetic.
customer_reviews.text: Diabetic Cookbook? A lot of the recipies I look at have a lot of refined sugar in them at a time when there are so many alternative sweeteners available. I suddenly needed to change my eating after hospitalization in November. I dont have time or drive to convert and test over and over, with something advertised as diabetic friendly. So dissappointed.
customer_reviews.author: VentuDebe

customer_reviews.title: I am confused?
customer_reviews.text: I am not a diabetic but I have to start controlling my sugar intake or I'll become one. I ordered this book because it seemed to have positive reviews, but I was pretty surprised to see a ton of recipes that call for cups of sugar. This recipe book seemed like some old fashioned recipe book to me and not something that is diabetes friendly.
customer_reviews.author: CLesterTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Healthy Eating Treat
customer_reviews.text: Although we're not diabetic we thought that this might help get us on track to healthier dining. So far it has been a real help. The dishes are great and easy to prepare. No loss to our dining pleasure. Slow cooking is always easy.
customer_reviews.author: StoneyB

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: great cook book for people with diabetic, will buy from this seller again
customer_reviews.author: Billy

customer_reviews.title: I guess it would be useful for someone who does not really know how to ...
customer_reviews.text: I do not find these recipes very diabetic friendly. They are just regular recipes. And overall the recipes are just repeats of the same thing just written by different individuals. I guess it would be useful for someone who does not really know how to cook. But if you are a good cook, your own recipes are likely better than these.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa M

customer_reviews.title: All in a Slow Cooker....who knew?
customer_reviews.text: I am just starting a diabetic eating plan, and I'm impressed with the information in this book. Reading your book on Kindle, but still want the book! Also,what caught my eye was the breads that are steamed in cans and in the slow cooker. Also, I liked the d.i.y seasoning mixes. I just like this publication...and hope to get the book form.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn L. Guillaum

customer_reviews.title: Not for diabetics
customer_reviews.text: I just downloaded this and flipped thoroughly through the Kindle version. OMG, so many of the recipes have carbs in them it’s ridiculous. In the week of suggested meals it has a dinner roll as a suggested side. Soups have rice. Chili recipe says 2 tablespoons sugar ?!? Waste of money, sadly.
customer_reviews.author: Sacramento Mom

customer_reviews.title: All inclusive cookbook
customer_reviews.text: This is an all inclusive cook pork. Great recipes for all, whether you are diabetic or not. Would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Sherlock

customer_reviews.title: This is for diabetics?
customer_reviews.text: I don't see how this is a diabetic cookbook. Lots of carbs and the desserts seemed are with sugar and honey. My mother, who's the diabetic, said it might work if you follow the exchanges system. It has a lot of recipes that sound good, but I wouldn't buy it for diabetics.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle A

customer_reviews.title: My recently diagnosed Mom is in love with this cookbook
customer_reviews.text: My recently diagnosed Mom is in love with this cookbook. She said the recipes are so simple and doesn't require expensive ingredients she doesn't normally buy.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya Moulton

customer_reviews.title: Total waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Eat anything you like, just control your portions. Here are some regular slow cooker recipes. That's the whole book in a nutshell. Since I already have the original cookbook, this one was a complete waste of my time and my money.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this book. I have a couple Fix-It and Forget-It cookbooks that I enjoy. This isnt one of them. Way too many of the same dishes that were very similar. Come on now, 5 split pea soup recipes, 29 chili recipes... Ceryainly not worth the price. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: QuiteTheHandful

customer_reviews.title: Not geared toward diabetics
customer_reviews.text: This cookbook is most definitely not geared toward diabetics as the title would indicate. Some great sounding recipes are included but should not be sold as a “diabetic” cookbook.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I am pre-diabetic and I love my slow cooker so this worked out very well for me. I don't always make diabetic meals but this has helped to keep me on track my making enough to last me a few days instead of just one meal.
customer_reviews.author: Marnie Parson

customer_reviews.title: Unoriginal and Repetitive
customer_reviews.text: Very repetitive with nearly identical recipes. Unless you are looking for 21 ways to make pot roast or 19 ways to make beef stew, you’ll have better luck elsewhere. So disappointed in this and sad I wasted money on it.
customer_reviews.author: Diz

customer_reviews.title: Simple, Easy & Tasty
customer_reviews.text: The Diabetic Cookbook was given to my mom. After looking through the recipes and seeing how simple, easy and tasty they sounded it made her feel like diabetes wouldn't limit her love of food as much as she thought. P.S. The recipes were so good, and healthy for the whole family.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah A. Kaminsky

customer_reviews.title: Fix-It and Forget-It Slow Cooker Diabetic Cookbook: 550 Slow Cooker Favorites
customer_reviews.text: I have enjoyed using this book to do some great recipes, I am prediabetic & working to hard to keep from becoming a full diabetic. It was received in great condition.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Diet Cookbook
customer_reviews.text: I gave this for a gift, the person really liked it, because he didn't know what to eat.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A lot of high carb recipes
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed with this cookbook. The recipes are okay but there's a lot of very high carb recipes which are not good for diabetes.
customer_reviews.author: AMBERSK

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best cookbooks for keeping carbs low in your diet.
customer_reviews.author: Cookie

customer_reviews.title: Great Cookbook
customer_reviews.text: Lots of recipes to choose from and a very nice looking cookbook.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Thought they would have good things in it
customer_reviews.text: It's not for me I guess. Thought they would have good things in it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love my diabetic slow cooker cookbook.
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for a diabetic who hates to cook. The recipes are concise, easy to read and easy to shops for.
customer_reviews.author: Donald M Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Meal Ideas for Anyone
customer_reviews.text: These recipes are geared to diabetics, but are great for anyone who wants to eat healthy (don't we all want to be healthy). If you love cooking in your crockpot, this is your cookbook.
customer_reviews.author: M. McCaul

customer_reviews.title: good recipes
customer_reviews.text: recipes are easy to follow as well as being tasty
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: I love it I’m so very pleased that I purchase the ...
customer_reviews.text: I love it I’m so very pleased that I purchase the book it’s so very much so ROCKS from the first page to the last as I read I find a lot recipes to used also I can mix up ingredients from others recipes to make it extra my own so sweet
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Maria Jaskolka

customer_reviews.title: Not for the Gormet Chef
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of cookbooks that used items that had to be purchased and not usually used in a kitchen devoted to down home cooking. These recipes were generally composed of common items. Plus I liked the ease of using the crock pot to fix a meal early in the day and have it available for evening meals with leftovers for the next lunch.
customer_reviews.author: texas sunflower

customer_reviews.title: not what I was expecting from the fix it and forget it group
customer_reviews.text: this is not a crockpot diabetic cookbook!, but a collection of recipes, most low carb, but not all, no color photographs for reference
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The meals I fixed have all been winners, Familyloved them!
customer_reviews.author: Marion L. Burch

customer_reviews.title: Great cook book
customer_reviews.text: I love slow cooker recipes - this book has some really great recipes - makes my life a lot easier - fast shipping
customer_reviews.author: sheryl

customer_reviews.title: nice cookbook
customer_reviews.text: This is a good cookbook. Ive already used recipies from it. Im new to slow cooker cooking and this makes the recipies simple to put together. Im pre diabetic so eating healthy is a must to keep my sugar on track.
customer_reviews.author: Melva Smith

customer_reviews.title: Just what is needed in cookbooks
customer_reviews.text: Use all the time because a family member is diabetic. Never use my old cookbooks anymore. Recipes make tasty dishes and we are all a little slimmer
customer_reviews.author: CR

customer_reviews.title: hello good info
customer_reviews.text: so i needed help so i got it i use it and ill keep this book
customer_reviews.author: DON IVERS

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: I didn't care for this cookbook. It had a lot of the same recipes only written differently. I gave it away and didn't even make one thing out of it. Most of the recipes had more ingredients than I could afford to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Easttxgranny

customer_reviews.title: Not what I hoped for
customer_reviews.text: The entire cookbook was numerous variations of a handful of recipes.
customer_reviews.author: D. L. Schindler

customer_reviews.title: Fix it and Forget Diabetic Cookbook
customer_reviews.text: This is the best cookbook I've found in a long time. Recipes are easy to find ingredients for and not only diabetic friendly but tasty. This is a meal maker for everyone in the family, they'll never know they are eating your way....
customer_reviews.author: sue

customer_reviews.title: Easy and delicious recipes for whole family to enjoy.
customer_reviews.text: Enjoyed several of the great recipes already. Look forward to trying more.
customer_reviews.author: Scoots

customer_reviews.title: user friendly
customer_reviews.text: works great for person who can't cook, easy to follow, forget it and go, then great meal.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn A. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: VERY USEFUL
customer_reviews.text: THIS WAS A GIFT FOR A FRIEND WHO IS STRUGGLING WITH DIABETES - SHE ABSOLUTELY LOVES IT AND, THOUGH I GAVE IT TO HER SOME TIME AGO, SHE STILL USES IT REGULARLY - GOOD PRODUCT AT A VERY GOOD PRICE.
customer_reviews.author: stage monkey

customer_reviews.title: Great variety of diabetic recipes that actually sound wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my dad who is a diabetic. He was thrilled with the variety of recipes.
customer_reviews.author: catherine nevin

customer_reviews.title: Food to Enjoy
customer_reviews.text: This recipe cook book of filled with delicious recipes, which are fun to prepare.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Keating

customer_reviews.title: ... in the morning and by dinner we have a great healthy meal
customer_reviews.text: Wife uses this for us and can start cooking in the morning and by dinner we have a great healthy meal.
customer_reviews.author: RayS

customer_reviews.title: Great for non cooks
customer_reviews.text: Easy recipes for everyone, very helpful for the diabetic who has not cooked before. For the person with no time the slow cooker is a great idea. Also bought the stove top and oven recipe book.
customer_reviews.author: Beach

customer_reviews.title: Eat up
customer_reviews.text: Great for my husband who is diabetic. Recipies are delicious!
customer_reviews.author: Cma

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really easy to follow. Only downside for me was lack of pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Jamal C.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A cookbook for diabetics with recipes which are easy. tasty, and use common affordable ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: NL Engel

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I've only tried a couple recipes but I enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Lane

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Book for Newly Diagnosed Type 2 Diabetes
customer_reviews.text: I found it extremely helpful and would recommend it to anyone with diabetes. Lots of great, easy to use recipies.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Away to fix meals that are good for my husband and his diabetes
customer_reviews.text: Away to fix meals that are good for my husband and his diabetes. Then be able to go about my day and get things done.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Some very high carb recipes.
customer_reviews.text: Not good for diabetics. Just a collection of recipes without much thought or theme. Very disappointing. Hard to call some of the recipes diabetic friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Becky L

customer_reviews.title: ... a cookbook for anything BUT this one is REALLY GOOD!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve NEVER used a cookbook for anything BUT this one is REALLY GOOD!!!
customer_reviews.author: C Y

customer_reviews.title: Cookbook
customer_reviews.text: Recommender by a person with this illness. Just been diagnosed with Type C2 so this is a good place to start with how to cook for diabetics
customer_reviews.author: Judie

customer_reviews.title: New ideas and new tastes to look forward to
customer_reviews.text: Have started using some of the recipes and have been very good so far New and exciting flavors and old standards
customer_reviews.author: Old #7

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like this book, and it doesn't call for seasoning, and things I don't have in my pantry.
customer_reviews.author: nano

customer_reviews.title: I
customer_reviews.text: Given as a gift, they appeared to have liked it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love diabetic cookbooks, it helps me eat the right foods.
customer_reviews.author: beverly forino

customer_reviews.title: very very fast delivery
customer_reviews.text: this is the best crockpot book I have I use it often as I have a diabetic in my home
customer_reviews.author: sj

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The recipes are excellent and most are very easy to fix. Great Book.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Crew

customer_reviews.title: Nothing special
customer_reviews.text: These recipes are not diabetic. The book has some guidelines for diabetics, but the recipes are like those found in any slow cooker cookbook.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mckinney

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The recipes are relatively easy to prepare, especially before I leave for work.
customer_reviews.author: Tomcar53

customer_reviews.title: Good book
customer_reviews.text: I ordered for my recently diagnosed diabetic sister. She loves it.
customer_reviews.author: enots

customer_reviews.title: I am a new Diabetic
customer_reviews.text: Who knew you could still have flavor in your food !! My Husband Loved the first receipt I tried cant wait to try more
customer_reviews.author: Kari promisel

customer_reviews.title: Some good recipes
customer_reviews.text: This book has a lot of nice recipes. Unfortunately most of them are for smaller slow cookers than I have. So I'm going to have to adjust the ingredients in a lot of the recipes. I haven't used the book yet but I read through it and since winter is at my door step I will be making recipes from the book.
customer_reviews.author: J. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Some great recipes - A lot of the recipes required preparation ...
customer_reviews.text: Some great recipes - A lot of the recipes required preparation prior to putting in the slow cooker.... I was looking for more "dump n cook" type of recipes.
customer_reviews.author: 1 Aunti Jan

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: Just an OK cookbook. Some of the recipes are not family size but pot luck dinner size that feed 20 people. Some of the recipes are not very appealing to southerners.
customer_reviews.author: CH

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for. Simple, with few ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: Patty Dettmer

customer_reviews.title: really healthy cooking
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to try the cookbook but I was pleased with the recipes I read. I also like the extra little information chart of calories and such. this was a product worth the money. A must for cookbook collectors.
customer_reviews.author: mellonie

customer_reviews.title: Fix It and Forget It Diabetic Cookbook
customer_reviews.text: Fix it and forget it Diabetic Cookbook.....easy recipes and easy to follow. Recommend highly to anyone not just diabetics. something for everyone's taste
customer_reviews.author: Judith L. Dean

customer_reviews.title: Diabetic Slowcooker Recipe Book
customer_reviews.text: I just received this yesterday and am only starting to look through it. I've had the other Fix It and Forget It cookbooks so I have not doubt I will find many good recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: helping me to cook and make better choices. use it three to four times a ...
customer_reviews.text: helping me to cook and make better choices. use it three to four times a week, make big batches to freeze. would recommend to people even if you don't have diabetes
customer_reviews.author: cokmeupsum

customer_reviews.title: not much different from a regular crockpot cookbook
customer_reviews.text: Sugar is cut down by using 1/3 part sugar, and 2/3 parts sugar substitute. That's the only change from standard recipes. There is even a "dump cake" recipe using a packaged cake mix. I don't find this book at all useful for diabetic cooking.
customer_reviews.author: senior citizen

customer_reviews.title: Fix - It and Forget-It Cookbook
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these books to give to diabetics I know who don't have a lot of time to cook. They have told me they enjoy the recipes in this book as well as the ease with which they are made.
customer_reviews.author: Juls

customer_reviews.title: Great cookbook
customer_reviews.text: It came faster than I thought. I am using it in my daily cooking. Because I cook after work and come tired, this is great for me because certain evenings we are doing things or to the movies and when we come home voilaaaaa the meal is ready.
customer_reviews.author: zoraida banks

customer_reviews.title: Great cookbook
customer_reviews.text: LOVE my new cookbook. Can't go wrong with any fix and forget it cookbooks!
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Not good.
customer_reviews.text: This was very generic. This book seems to be all about moderation than better meals for diabetics. It seems to be an everyday cookbook with the word "Diabetes " thrown in.
customer_reviews.author: Jem

customer_reviews.title: great book for my diabetic mother
customer_reviews.text: great book for my diabetic mother. We have also used many of the recipes in this book, we brought a few more books for family members.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Velasquez

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: I have another Fix It and Forget it cookbook and alot of the recipes are repeated in this one. Ended up giving it to a diabetic friend
customer_reviews.author: Annette M Dobbs

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I especially appreciate the nutritional chart because I need to monitor my sodium and also my husband's carbs.
customer_reviews.author: Debi Sue

customer_reviews.title: Slow Cooker Diabetic Cookbook
customer_reviews.text: This is a very detailed diabetic cookbook. I am looking forward to trying the recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: Helpful book
customer_reviews.text: We all enjoy using the crockpot and now one for a diabetic is perfect. So helpful. GIve it a try.
customer_reviews.author: Wags

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It was what I needed and fit what i needed.
customer_reviews.author: Charles L. Arendts

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great wat to control my sugar and lose weight and tasty
customer_reviews.author: NQR4

customer_reviews.title: Fix it and Forget It Diabetic Cookbook
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed with this edition, as it repeated with little modification, recipes from the original Fix It and Forget It and Fix It and Forget it Lightly books. This book would be OK if you didn't own the other two. The print is nice and large and easy to read. The recipes, like the other books,, do not call for "exotic" ingredients and are good.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good recipe, sad to say I havent really used it.
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: There are quite a lot of recipes and some will become my favorite. There really is no better way to cook ...
customer_reviews.text: It suits my needs. Takes a little time to get used to how the Kindle works in finding a particular recipe without having to scroll through the entire book. That's why I didn't give it a full 5 stars. There are quite a lot of recipes and some will become my favorite. There really is no better way to cook meals than with a slow cooker. Great recipes inside, so don't pass this deal by.
customer_reviews.author: Sincronicity

customer_reviews.title: Diabetic cookbook
customer_reviews.text: this cookbook has a number of family favorites remade to allow a diabetic to eat without the guilt or the extra drudgery of trying to come up with a remix of your own. It also contains the information needed that allows you to easily count carbs., etc. also my family has been hard pressed to find fault with the meals prepared from this cookbook.
customer_reviews.author: Linda L. Psilas

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Adds to my collection of fix it and forget it cookbooks!
customer_reviews.author: Donna E Mason

customer_reviews.title: Cool beans
customer_reviews.text: Got this to cook for my wife better. Am excited to try some of the recipes that I've read so far.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: good I just don't use as much as I thought. I don't always have the ingredients on hand.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Reiter

customer_reviews.title: I like the recipes in this book
customer_reviews.text: I like the recipes in this book, as a newly diagnosed type II diabetic, I will be trying a lot of these recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Amy L Rush

customer_reviews.title: A Cookbook you can use
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased way too many cookbooks over the years and most are collecting dust. What sets this book apart from the rest is 1) Ingredients I can easily find at our local store 2) Simple instructions that don`t require hours of preparation I must admit that I don`t understand the relation to diabetes. I purchased several cookbooks targeting diabetics along with this one. They all have meals high in carbohydrates and sugar. Even if I weren`t trying to control blood sugar through diet, this would be a useful cookbook and I am glad to have it.
customer_reviews.author: G. Lowden

customer_reviews.title: it is great! I highly recommend this book
customer_reviews.text: it is great! I highly recommend this book. I like using my crockpot.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Smith

customer_reviews.title: Yummy
customer_reviews.text: Love this book. The recipes are easy to understand and taste delicious!
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Bartholomew

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy the recipes but there are several that repeat themselves by different people. Just slight variations
customer_reviews.author: Chris
